title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: This classic novel follows the romantic entanglements of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, set against the backdrop of early 19th-century England

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: This historical romance follows the story of Claire Randall, a World War II nurse who time travels to 18th-century Scotland and falls in love with a Scottish warrior.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A heartwarming and emotional story of Louisa Clark and Will Traynor, exploring themes of love, loss, and the choices we make in life.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: This iconic mystery novel follows ten strangers trapped on an isolated island, where they start dying one by one.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A gripping psychological thriller about the disappearance of Amy Dunne and the suspicions that fall on her husband, Nick.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A high-fantasy epic that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring, set in the enchanting world of Middle-earth.

title: Harry Potter
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A beloved fantasy series that chronicles the magical journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he battles the dark wizard, Lord Voldemort.

title: The Wheel of Time
author: Robert Jordan
description: An extensive epic fantasy series featuring a richly detailed world and an array of compelling characters.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller centered around Alicia Berenson, a famous painter who hasn't spoken since she was found standing next to her husband's dead body.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A comprehensive biography of the co-founder of Apple Inc., exploring Jobs' visionary ideas and complex personality.

title: Alexander Hamilton
author: Ron Chernow
description: This biography explores the life of Alexander Hamilton, a Founding Father of the United States and an influential figure in the country's early history.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic horror novel that introduced the iconic vampire Count Dracula and set the standard for vampire lore in popular culture.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful and timeless novel that addresses themes of racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: Thinking,Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman presents the workings of the mind and the two systems that drive the way we think.
